thread.title: Man with no ticket boards plane at Dallas Airport
thread.title_full: Man with no ticket boards plane at Dallas Airport

title: Man with no ticket boards plane at Dallas Airport
text:
Man with no ticket boards plane at Dallas Airport Last updated 08:28, July 28 2015 Reuters 
A man managed to get through a security checkpoint and board a commercial flight in Dallas, without a ticket. 
Police have arrested a man who got through security at Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport and boarded a plane without a ticket. 
Airport officials said that a car parked curbside outside a terminal was searched and no threat was found. 
Authorities say the 26-year-old man somehow got through a Transportation Security Administration checkpoint on Sunday night despite not having a ticket. The man then boarded a commercial flight. 
An airport agent contacted law enforcement after the man boarded. He was arrested on a charge of criminal trespassing. 
The man's name hasn't been released. 
The flight was delayed because of the incident. Additional details about the flight weren't released. 
TSA spokesman Mike England says the agency is reviewing the incident and has added more barriers to screening areas at the airport.
